J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> I checked the source. The constructor is public.

I dont understand, I still get

Error			The constructor ExceptionTestCase(String) is undefined	

when I add the normal TestCase constructor:

     public Exception1Test(String arg0) {
         super(arg0);
     }



> 
> 1. Are you using JUnit 3.8.1?

I saw it's 3.7


but as you recommended, I won't use it.
I am familiar with the traditional way. I thought there is a benefit but as I 
saw in ExceptionTestCaseTest it's about the same programming effort but a 
weird construction.

I think it should be removed from the junit.extensions, it's distracting.

cheers,

Lu
subject: Re: [junit] how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
